Home → Libraries → Shotley

Shotley (Suffolk Libraries Local)

Manager: Tom Veasey

Shotley Village Hall, The Street, Shotley, Ipswich
IP9 1LX

  • Tel:
  • Email: help@suffolklibraries.co.uk
  • Facebook

Branch updates

  • Browse and borrow books, attend a range of activities and use IT facilities.
  • Self-service available during activities.
  • Payment facilities not available at Suffolk Libraries Local branches. Call 01473 351249 for any payments.

Day Hours
Monday 1300-1700

IT and printing facilities

  • Free internet access on library Chromebooks

Regular events and activities

Children’s events

Homework club

Monday, 1515-1600

Staff available to help with homework projects, borrowing books etc. Children under 7 must be accompanied by an adult.

Singing and stories

Monday, 1415-1445

Stories, nursery rhymes and songs for 0-4 year-olds.

Find out more about Wordplay

Older people’s events

Sporting Memories reminiscence group

second Monday of the month, 1300-1445

Handle sports images and memorabilia, revisit and share memories of sport, talk about any kind of sport, take part in quizzes, games and gentle activities and make new friends.

Top Time: events and activities for older people

Monday, 1300-1400

Rolling timetable of book groups, board games, talks and craft activities.

Councillor surgeries & professional advice

Babergh District Council mobile customer access point

first Monday of the month., 1300-1630

Drop in for council services.

Upcoming special events

No upcoming special events.
